TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SpotLight extends System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PointLightBase

Docs.summary: Light object that projects its effect in a cone-shaped area along a specified direction.

remarks.format:
## Remarks SpotLight is a kind of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PointLight>, since it has a position, range, and attenuation. However, SpotLight also allows you to control the direction, shape, and other properties of the cone of the light's effect.
Specify values for <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.OuterConeAngle%2A> (beyond which nothing is illuminated), and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.InnerConeAngle%2A> (within which everything is fully illuminated) to change the spotlighting effect.
Lighting between the outside of the inner cone and the outer cone falls off linearly.
![Spotlight diagram](~/add/media/spotlight-1.png "Spotlight diagram")
## Examples The following example shows how to create a SpotLight in a 3-D scene.
[!code-xml[3DGallery_snip#SpotLightExampleInline1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/3DGallery/SpotLightExample.xaml#spotlightexampleinline1)]
The following code shows the entire sample.
[!code-xml[3DGallery_snip#SpotLightExampleWholePage](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/3DGallery/SpotLightExample.xaml#spotlightexamplewholepage)]

Angle that defines a cone within which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a that specifies the direction in which the projects its light.
Docs.value: that specifies the direction of the Spotlight's projection. The default value is `0,0,-1`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an angle that specifies the proportion of a 's cone-shaped projection in which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene.
Docs.value: The angle in degrees that specifies the proportion of a 's cone-shaped projection in which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene. The default value is `180`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intensity of the 's illumination diminishes from full illumination to none in that angle of the light's projection between the InnerConeAngle and the . ![Spotlight diagram](~/add/media/spotlight-1.png "Spotlight diagram") ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to create a in a 3-D scene. Docs.summary: Gets or sets an angle that specifies the proportion of a 's cone-shaped projection outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene.
Docs.value: The angle in degrees that specifies the proportion of a 's cone-shaped projection outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene. The default value is `90`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intensity of the 's illumination diminishes from full illumination to none in that angle of the light's projection between the and the OuterConeAngle. The light provides no illumination outside the angle specified by this property. ![Spotlight diagram](~/add/media/spotlight-1.png "Spotlight diagram") ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to create a in a 3-D scene.
